body:
Comment 7 by **lvdlvd**: 
what exactly do you mean by 'use runtime-gdb.py'?

i've been able to reproduce the freebsd-9 reported crash with gdb 7.4 built from ports,
but it had nothing to do with runtime-gdb.py.  If i set a breakpoint at main.main, run
(hits that breakpoint) and then continue, the program ran fine, but if i just ran
directly, it would crash, apparently after creating a thread.   building gdb 7.4 without
trhead support made the crash go away.  gdb 7.3 doesn't seem to have this problem.
